intro: Apalochlamys, commonly known as the mountain orchid, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, often fragrant flowers and is native to the high-altitude regions of South America. The plants typically have slender stems and are adapted to grow in rocky or mountainous environments. Apalochlamys species are known for their small, intricate flowers that come in a variety of colors, including white, pink, and purple. Due to their specific habitat requirements, many species are threatened by habitat loss and climate change.
